creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by the artist with the assistance of Keiko Gallery
description: squat, disk-shaped form with raised neck, and deeply indented center; center is shiny red with gold undertone; exterior of form is brown and lumpy, bark-like
medium: Lacquer, earth powder, and gold leaf
text: In 1992 Fujita began with his new series Layered Form where he experimented with various forms—from long, boat-shaped sculptures to upright U shapes—and it took him several years to develop his signature formula, which is reflected in this work as well as the nearby Layered Form 5, both from 2004.
title: Layered Form 1
